name: create table `mqtt`
template: CREATE TABLE mqtt (id int(11) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT, timestamp datetime NOT NULL, topic text COLLATE utf8_unicode_ci NOT NULL, data text COLLATE utf8_unicode_ci NOT NULL, UNIQUE KEY id (id)) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8 COLLATE=utf8_unicode_ci;

name: Criteria
Format query 2
template:
SELECT
 CEILING(time/3600000)*3600000 AS timestamp,
 AVG(data1) AS `data1`,
 AVG(data2) AS `data2`
FROM dbasename
WHERE time > {{payload}}
GROUP BY `timestamp`;

name: Peak Shaving flow
info:
Recognize peaks in power consumption.

Create temporary clone of database table.
Retrieve an array of power readings including the posedge and negedge values
-- select a certain range
-- plot the data
Split the array in individual elements
If the posedge or negedge values fulfil certain criteria a peak is definded
If a peak is fully defined (start, end, height),then it is inserted into a table with peak data.
The power data in the temp table is adapted. Peak is subtracted from the trace.
Repeat this for all data in the range
Start over with less easy (sm
aller contrast ) peaks.

Remove temporary clone of database table

name: CLONE TABLE epower into tmp_epower
LIST tmp_epower
template: SELECT * FROM tmp_epower WHERE timestamp < DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 100 MINUTE) AND timestamp < DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 120 MINUTE);

name: CREATE TABLE `epower2`
template: CREATE TABLE epower2 (power_id INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT, timestamp TIMESTAMP, power INT(5), posedge INT(5), negedge INT(5), PRIMARY KEY (power_id));

template: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tmp_epower  WHERE timestamp < DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 25 MINUTE);

name: LIST tmp_epower
template: SELECT * FROM tmp_epower WHERE timestamp > DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 2 DAY);

name: NOTE: tmp_epower is a snapshot (because cloned).
info:
This implies that a selection window based on NOW() moves over the selection
This is not desirable while testing

name: INIT CHART
INJECT CHART DATA INTO CHART OBJECT

template: SELECT timestamp AS 'x', posedge AS 'y' FROM tmp_epower;

name: FINISH CHART OBJECT
INIT CHART
INJECT CHART DATA INTO CHART OBJECT
FINISH CHART OBJECT
LIST tmp_epower
template: SELECT timestamp AS 'x', posedge AS 'y' FROM tmp_epower WHERE timestamp > DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 2 DAY) AND posedge < 8000;

name: LIST tmp_epower
template: SELECT timestamp AS 'x', posedge / (power-posedge) AS 'y' FROM tmp_epower WHERE timestamp > DATE_SUB(NOW(), INTERVAL 2 DAY) AND posedge < 8000;

name: LIST tmp_epower
template: SELECT timestamp AS 'timestamp', posedge / (power-posedge) AS 'contrast' FROM tmp_epower;

name: MySQL cleanup flow
info:
Create a flow that cleans up a database table
The purpose is to obtain a table that contains data over
a limited (tunable) period.

Before deleting the oldest data, you may generate a
database table containg aggregates.

E.g. life data, dayly, weekly, monthly, yearly aggregates
The aggregator flow:

- takes a database table as input
- generate a database table with aggregates
- yes/no deletes the data over the aggregated period
- is suitable to be used in a chain, e.g. with
- live, hourly, daily, weekly, monthly tables
- aggregation periods to be defined
- storage periods to be defined
- aggregation types to be defined:
-  e.g. min, max, sum, average etc

Generate a form-driven dashboard interface

Practice on Plugwise data. Compare the results with those 
from the Plugwise app

Enter Input table name  e.g. epower2
Choose period     e.g. weekly, hourly
Output table name e.g. epower2_hourly
Choose deletetion period
Select option yes / no delete
Delete (only after aggregate update)

name: INSERT INTO tasks
template: INSERT INTO tasks (task_name, input_table, input_field, agg_period, delete_, count_, max_, min_, sum_, average_, active_, last_input_id, next_run) VALUES ( '{{payload.task_name}}', '{{payload.input_table}}', '{{payload.input_field}}', '{{payload.agg_period}}', {{payload.delete_}}, {{payload.count_}}, {{payload.max_}}, {{payload.min_}}, {{payload.sum_}}, {{payload.average_}}, {{payload.active_}}, 0, null);

name: CREATE TABLE tasks
template: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS tasks (task_id INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT, timestamp TIMESTAMP, task_name CHAR(30), input_table CHAR(10), input_field CHAR(10), agg_period CHAR(10), delete_ BOOLEAN, count_ BOOLEAN, max_ BOOLEAN, min_ BOOLEAN, sum_ BOOLEAN, average_ BOOLEAN, active_ BOOLEAN, last_input_id INT, next_run DATETIME, PRIMARY KEY (task_id));
